TopicTitle: [BUG] Physics Error - Ship falls faster than Kerbal!

Articles.Content:
When falling from an altitude withwith an atmosphere, a spacecraft always falls away from the kerbal when in free fall. When holding a sock and a bowling ball in real life, you would expect them to fall at the same time!

In KSP, the aerodynamic forces on the space craft would be more than on a kerbal, meaning the kerbal would accelerate towards the craft in theory. Unfortunately, the craft falls faster, hence a physics glitch. Please fix!!

No.

A kerbal has much less mass so is affected more by aerodynamic forces than the craft, which has more inertia, and dropping a bowling ball and a sock in an atmosphere would result in the sock slowing first.

You may be thinking of the famous experiment with a hammer and a feather on the moon, that works because there is no air resistance acting on either object.

Closing.
